# Synapse PySpark notebook cell
import requests
from pyspark.sql.types import StructType, StructField, IntegerType, StringType
from pyspark.sql import Row

owner = "microsoft"
repo = "sql-server-samples"
path = "samples/databases/adventure-works/oltp-install-script"
branch = "master"

url = f"https://api.github.com/repos/{owner}/{repo}/contents/{path}?ref={branch}"
resp = requests.get(url)
resp.raise_for_status()
items = resp.json()

csv_files = [item["name"] for item in items if item["name"].lower().endswith(".csv")]
base_raw = f"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/{owner}/{repo}/{branch}/{path}/"
csv_urls = [{"file": f, "url": base_raw + f} for f in csv_files]

# Build Spark DataFrame
rows = [Row(sno=i+1, CSV_File_Name=r["file"], Raw_GitHub_URL=r["url"]) for i, r in enumerate(csv_urls)]
df_meta = spark.createDataFrame(rows)

display(df_meta)

# Write to ADLS Gen2 (Parquet)
# Replace container/account with your values and ensure Spark has access (linked service / managed identity)
# https://adlsrmadwdev.blob.core.windows.net/audit
#https://adlsrmadwdev.blob.core.windows.net/audit
#adls_path = "abfss://<container>@<storage_account>.dfs.core.windows.net/csv_metadata/csv_scr_config.parquet"
#df_meta.write.mode("overwrite").parquet(adls_path)

adls_path = "abfss://audit@adlsrmadwdev.dfs.core.windows.net/csv_metadata/csv_scr_config.parquet"
df_meta.write.mode("overwrite").parquet(adls_path)


# Optional: also register a Spark table for ad-hoc queries
df_meta.write.mode("overwrite").saveAsTable("dev_csv_scr_config")  # if you want a spark catalog table
